reviews.text: The symbol of Battambang. The story behind the character this statue represents is where Battambang got its name. Literally translated "lost stick". If one gets the chance it is quite a good story to read up on. You can find it by googling it.
There was a big praying in 8 days a time of local people who believe in spirits to have lucky, wealthiest ... and or other safe trip for their traveling.
Very long historical of Khmer.  The symbol of Battambang Province
Lokta dombang krongoung , the symbol of Battambang Province
Good place for pray.

A nice small temple. Good to stroll around and take some photos. There were not any tourists besides us on this site. Entrance is $1 and going around takes around 15-20 minutes.

Nextdoor one can find a large statue of a buddha.

Not worth the ride
It's a at least 20 to 25 minutes ride from the city center. What you will find is just another old Pagode Ruin 
Really nothing special or something to notify.
More like a walk in a park.
1$ entrance fee
The base where Buddha is sitting is made of bricks giving the pagoda a “ unfinished “ look.
Beautiful .
No view, no special food... not a right place I’m looking for.

A nice small temple. Good to stroll around and take some photos. There were not any tourists besides us on this site. Entrance is $1 and going around takes around 15-20 minutes.

Nextdoor one can find a large statue of a buddha.

Not worth the ride
It's a at least 20 to 25 minutes ride from the city center. What you will find is just another old Pagode Ruin 
Really nothing special or something to notify.
More like a walk in a park.
1$ entrance fee
The base where Buddha is sitting is made of bricks giving the pagoda a “ unfinished “ look.
Beautiful .
No view, no special food... not a right place I’m looking for.

An active temple with a horrofic history. The older temple around this area was used as a place to keep prisoners during the Khmer Rouge era.

This is a good place to see before visiting the "Killing Fields" which are located right next to the Wat Samrong Knong.

An ancient Buddhist pagoda. The former main temple is on the process of putting its name into the World Heritage list. The temple itself is full of glories and horror.
During Khmer Krohorm period, the temple was used as a captive for prisoners who were mostly ordinary people. 10,008 people lost their lives. 

The compound is tranquil and filled with calm after the tragedy.

Another wat, but this place has a bit of history to it, though rather dark...this was the site of one of the many 'killing fields' of the Khmer Rouge, reportedly over  10.000 people were tortured and killed here...a memorial in the back is filled with skulls and bones that were recovered later...oh dear!
beautiful, serene, shady trees temple complex with killing field memorials
Passing  by.

I adore! 

Situated on the east side of the river, it's an environment more quiet than all other restaurants in the centre of Battambang crowded by tourists.

1- Delicious food! The majority of the menu is fresh & homemade. I went twice and I always enjoyed it!
2- Very reasonable prices. I eat for less than $5 for a substantial plate of fried eggplant with pork & egged noodles + a fresh lemonade + few pieces of pineapple for dessert.
3- Humble restaurant but welcoming atmosphere surrounded by bamboos decoration. 
When you arrive to the restaurant you enter in the heart of a traditional Khmer familial lifestyle. You are welcomed by the children of the owner and her cousin. Veevi, the owner, is a lovely and sweet person. I spent 2 hours to talk with her as the restaurant was empty. Recently, she reopening it alone. She does her best to make it alive again.
She told me she has new project for her restaurant.
Good products and service
특별히 즐길거리가 없는 바탐방에서 좋은 ㄹ길거리인것 같습니다. 거리도 가끼워 찾기도 쉽습니다. 하지만 1인당 5불과 반 강요하는 팁(1불)은 눈실을 찌푸리게 합니다. 그래도 추천할만한 곳입니다.

簡單有趣的竹子火車，坐上去，旅程有無限驚喜。
建議8時去坐，早一點沿途涼風送爽，超讚
The staff are all friendly, the prices are acceptable, their also a lot of nice souvenirs to buy, the quality of the motorcycle are excellent

Rented motorbike here. Seems like a professional business. $7 for 24h rental of automatical motorbike. Left passport and was given bike with tank full! First place in Asia I get the tank full and not empty. So you just replace what you use, whic is better. I drove around all day and paid $1.40 to fill it back up. -1 star bc of waiver. The waiver makes me a little nervous as you are to be responsible "for anything that happens to the bike while in your possession" including paying $1000 for it if it gets stolen. I asked for a lock after seeing that (not normally included), but just glad I have insurance as that would be quite the cost if someone decided to steal from you.
Good scooters for a very cheap price. Friendly staff. Would recommend.

The lady who works there is really sweet!! We rented a moto and everything was ok. Just take a video of the hole vechicle before renting because they check everything on drop off and they charge if you can not prove you did not do the scratch
Had a nice lunch, salads very fresh ingredients. It was all good....

Good place for evening food. We have tried spicy shells and rice with pineapple. Both very good. The dragon fruit shake was very watery, but the mango shake was quite good. The staff speaks English and it is easy to order. Go before 20.00, otherwise it gets very busy. Prices are 1,5 - 3 USD per plate of food, shakes are for 1 USD.

Food stall located in the night market, just by the river. Super cheap and amazing Khmer food. Vannak also offers a great cooking class, which is in the countryside for an authentic experience! Would recommend to anyone visiting Battambang.
Excellent Khmer food and high quality. The best food I have tried in Cambodia. Totally recommend it!

Vannak is an awesome guy and very good teacher. He takes the class nice and slow for everyone and you get to select the dishes you'd like to cook. All very traditional without any msg or added Chinese influence. The classes he said are usually small groups so it's easy for him to teach and be heard.

Authentic experience 
The cooking class was amazing. You start by buying the products in a local market with Vannak,  and then you go to his place to cook 3 delicious meals. Of course, at the end you can  eat your meals ! Vanny speaks very good english and we learnt a lot about khmer cuisine. I would definitively recommand it. A must do in Battambang !

Very good place to enjoy an evening meal, and although there are a lot of food options in the area, this place is very cosy and welcoming. Inside there are two types of seating: tatami mats close to the floor, as one might encounter in Korean and Japanese homes; and the conventional upright seating more common in Cambodia.
  Outside, in front of the restaurant, there are some tables sheltered from the road by plants. Actually, the foliage is so effective at this that one might have difficulty identifying the restaurant sign if you visit this place in the evening.
  Several vegan options, and you’ll only need to order one item to be satisfied. Pretty good value and nice service. The stir fried vegetables are - rather unusually - prepared with one of a number of sauces . You have to specify one. The one I had was pretty nice - peppery, and with a lot of cabbage which I like done this way. There is tofu elsewhere in the menu though. The place would suit plant based eaters, solo diners, couples, and small groups of four.

Very yummy vegetarian food for a reasonable price! 
I had one of their curries with some fried spring rolls and it was all fresh and good tasting!
Would definitely recommend it.
Excellent value for the price. Wonderful people. Best inexpensive breakfast in town.

They have vegan options! And it's a great cafe for digital nomads.
The moment I saw the appealing outdoor seating, I knew it was going to be a good space to work as a digital nomad. The space is quite big, they have WIFI and plenty of vegan options. Their vegan items are clearly marked on their menu. I ordered soft vegan black bean tacos $3.50 and one vegan burrito, $3.50. 

Pros: Free WIFI, Friendly Service, Lots of vegan options, Good space to work and eat
Had the best veggie Thai green curry here!! Would definitely recommend!
